definitions.definition: A second or subsequent reading of a text or artifact in an attempt to gain new insights.
definitions.example: I need to make a review of the book before I can understand it.

definitions.definition: An account intended as a critical evaluation of a text or a piece of work.
definitions.example: The newspaper review was full of praise for the play.

definitions.definition: A judicial reassessment of a case or an event.
definitions.example: The victims demanded a full judicial review of the case.

definitions.definition: A stage show made up of topical sketches etc.
definitions.example: The Cambridge Footlights Review launched many Monty Python faces.

definitions.definition: A survey of the available items or material.
definitions.example: The magazine contained a review of Paris restaurants.

definitions.definition: A periodical which makes a survey of the arts or some other field.
definitions.example: The Times Literary Review is published in London.

definitions.definition: A military inspection or display for the benefit of superiors or VIPs.
definitions.example: The troops assembled for a review by the Queen.

definitions.definition: A forensic inspection to assess compliance with regulations or some code.
definitions.example: The regulators demanded a review against NYSE practices.

definitions.definition: To survey; to look broadly over.
definitions.example: Before I tackle the question directly, I must briefly review historical approaches to the problem.

definitions.definition: To write a critical evaluation of a new art work etc.; to write a review.
definitions.example: The critic reviews every new play in London.

definitions.definition: To look back over in order to correct or edit; to revise.
To look over again (something previously written or learned), especially in preparation for an examination.
To view or see again; to look back on.
To retrace; to go over again.
